name: five
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
A1 the number 5: Five, four, three, two, one, blast-off! I work five days a week.
More examplesFewer examplesHe runs five miles every day.There are five leaflets - please take one of each.We plan to increase our exports over the next five years.This building has five floors.He eventually won the match after five gruelling sets.

See also

five noun
(TEAM)
[ C, +sing/pl verb ] a team of five players, such as in basketball: starting five The team returned its entire starting five from last season's championship season. Synonym
quintet
More examplesFewer examplesThe team didn't feature one American-born player in its starting five.What will their starting five look like next season?

five noun
(GAME)
fives
an English sport in which two or four players hit a small hard ball with a glove against the three walls of the playing area: Eton fives He played cricket, hockey, squash, and Eton fives.
More examplesFewer examplesTeams from all over the country visit Cambridge for their impressive Fives facilities.St Paul’s and Winchester are facing a new rivalry at fives.Similar to squash, fives players take it in turns to strike the ball against the front wall.
Idioms
give me five!
give someone five
take five
Add to word list
Add to word list
5: We work five days a week. a five-room apartment
Five can also mean five o’clock.
